page.title: 09Gristhorpe,amenities.
page.content: In a recent survey conducted by the Parish Council it was found that most residents are satisfied with the services available. Some people felt the need for mains gas,a pre-school playgroup and a petrol station(the previous one having closed when the by-pass was built). The by-pass was initially unpopular but is now accepted because it diverts all but local traffic. The amenities and shops in the village are well used and bread,milk, confectionary and newspapers are delivered in the village.Some residents expressed a dissatisfaction with the lack of an appointment system at the Filey surgery. In conclusion it was felt that the village was near enough to Filey and Scarborough for additional needs.
